iti71:1.1: This was said by the Buddha, the Perfected One: that is what I heard.
iti71:2.1: “Mendicants, I’ve seen beings who engaged in good conduct of body, speech, and mind, who did not abuse the noble ones, who held right view and acted accordingly.
iti71:2.2: At the breaking up of the body, after death, they were reborn in a good destination, a heaven world.
iti71:3.1: Now, I don’t say this because I’ve heard it from some other ascetic or brahmin.
iti71:3.4: I only say it because I’ve known, seen, and realized it for myself.”
iti71:4.3: That is what the Buddha said.
iti71:5.1: “When the mind has been directed right,
iti71:5.3: and right bodily deeds have been done,
iti71:6.2: though their life may be short,
iti71:6.3: when their body breaks up, that wise person
iti71:7.1: This too was spoken by the Blessed One: that is what I heard.
